title: bst-contains?
description: Write a function `bst-contains?` that takes a binary search tree and a value, and returns true if the value is in the tree, and false otherwise.

examples.explanation: 5 is not in an empty tree
5 is found in a single node tree
8 is found in the right subtree

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (bst-contains? t val))

(bst-contains? empty 5)
(bst-contains? (make-node empty empty 5) 5)
(bst-contains? (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5) 8)
(bst-contains? (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5) 3)
hiddenCases: (check-expect (bst-contains? (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5) 6) true)
(check-expect (bst-contains? (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5) 9) false)
(check-expect (bst-contains? (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 15) 12) 10) 15) true)
(check-expect (bst-contains? (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) empty 10) 12) false)
